main event: On 25 July 1952, three lights were observed traveling rapidly in Manchester, Tennessee.
interesting points: The lights were visible for about 5 seconds., The lights resembled navigation lights on a large transport aircraft but moved too fast to be one., The observation included the involvement of multiple witnesses., The sky was clear during the sighting, enhancing visibility., No photographs were present in the report.
witness description: George D. Pulliam, Jr. was among the observers, a 40-year-old male commercial pilot and flight instructor.
